title: Tartine Jambon Fromage
content:
Ingredients:
- 2 tranches de pain de campagne
- 2 tranches de jambon blanc
- 50g de fromage râpé (Comté ou Emmental)

Instructions:
1. Préchauffer le four à 180°C (350°F).
2. Placer le jambon sur chaque tranche de pain, puis recouvrir généreusement de fromage râpé.
3. Enfourner pour 5-7 minutes, jusqu'à ce que le fromage soit fondu et légèrement doré. Servir chaud.

title: Simple Dal Tadka
content:
Ingredients:
- 3 patatas medianas
- 4 huevos grandes
- 1 cebolla pequeña (opcional)
- Aceite de oliva virgen extra
- Sal al gusto

Instructions:
1. Pelar las patatas y la cebolla (si se usa). Cortar las patatas en rodajas finas y la cebolla en juliana.
2. Calentar abundante aceite de oliva en una sartén a fuego medio. Añadir las patatas y la cebolla. Cocinar a fuego lento, removiendo ocasionalmente, hasta que las patatas estén tiernas. Escurrir bien el exceso de aceite.
3. En un bol grande, batir los huevos con una pizca de sal. Añadir las patatas y la cebolla escurridas y mezclar. Verter la mezcla en una sartén antiadherente con un poco de aceite caliente. Cocinar a fuego medio-bajo hasta que los bordes estén cuajados. Con la ayuda de un plato, dar la vuelta a la tortilla y cocinar por el otro lado hasta que esté dorada.

title: Pimientos de Padrón
content:
Ingredients:
- 1 bunch morning glory (rau muống)
- 4-5 cloves garlic
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 2 tablespoons cooking oil

Instructions:
1. Wash the morning glory thoroughly, trim off the tough ends, and cut the stems and leaves into 2-inch pieces.
2. Peel and finely mince the garlic cloves.
3. Heat cooking oil in a large wok or pan over medium-high heat until shimmering.
4. Add the minced garlic and stir-fry quickly until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
5. Add the prepared morning glory to the wok. Stir-fry vigorously for 2-3 minutes until it starts to wilt.
6. Season with fish sauce and sugar. Continue to stir-fry for another minute until the morning glory is tender-crisp.
7. Serve hot immediately, typically with steamed rice.

title: Kai Jeow Moo Sab
content:
Ingredients:
- 200g block of feta cheese
- 1 large ripe tomato
- 2 tablespoons olive oil

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F). Place the feta cheese in a small oven-safe dish.
2. Slice the tomato and arrange the slices around the feta. Drizzle generously with olive oil.
3. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the feta is soft and slightly golden and the tomatoes are tender.

title: 김치볶음밥 (Kimchi Bokkeumbap)
content:
Ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 1 cup chopped kimchi
- 1 tbsp cooking oil

Instructions:
1. Heat cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped kimchi and stir-fry for 2 minutes.
2. Add cooked rice to the pan and mix thoroughly with the kimchi. Continue stir-frying for 3-4 minutes, breaking up any rice clumps.
3. Serve immediately.

title: Simple Egg Donburi
content:
Ingredients:
- 1 cup elbow macaroni
- 2 cups water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese

Instructions:
1. Combine macaroni, water, and salt in a medium skillet. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until water is mostly absorbed and macaroni is tender.
2. Stir in the milk and shredded cheddar cheese until the cheese is melted and a creamy sauce forms.
3. Serve hot.

title: Pad Pak Ruam Mit Tao Huu
content:
Ingredients:
- 1 block (200g) feta cheese
- 1 large tomato
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Slice the tomato and place it around and on top of the feta in a small oven-safe dish.
2. Drizzle the olive oil over the feta and tomatoes. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano and a pinch of black pepper.
3. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the feta is soft and slightly golden. Serve immediately.

title: Penne al Pomodoro e Basilico Fresco
content:
Ingredients:
- 320g penne pasta
- 500g ripe cherry tomatoes
- 2 cloves garlic
- A large handful of fresh basil leaves
- 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- Salt and black pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. Cook the penne pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain, reserving about half a cup of the pasta water.
2. While the pasta cooks, halve the cherry tomatoes and thinly slice the garlic cloves.
3. In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant, being careful not to burn it. Add the halved cherry tomatoes, a pinch of salt, and a splash of reserved pasta water. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the tomatoes soften and release their juices.
4. Add the drained pasta to the pan with the tomatoes. Toss well. Tear the fresh basil leaves and add them to the pasta. Season with black pepper and adjust salt if needed. Toss again and serve immediately.

title: Spaghetti al Limone Semplice
content:
Ingredients:
- 320g spaghetti
- 2 lemons (zest and juice)
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 60ml extra virgin olive oil
- Salt to taste
- Freshly ground black pepper
- A handful of fresh parsley, chopped

Instructions:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to package directions in a large pot of salted water until al dente. Reserve about 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
2. While the pasta cooks, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the minced garlic and cook gently for 1-2 minutes until fragrant, being careful not to brown it.
3. Add the lemon zest and lemon juice to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper. Stir well.
4. Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it directly to the skillet with the lemon sauce.
5. Toss the spaghetti to coat, adding a splash of the reserved pasta water as needed to create a light, creamy sauce.
6. Stir in the chopped fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

title: Sweet Fried Plantains
content:
Ingredients:
- Fresh green beans (300g)
- Garlic (3 cloves)
- Soy sauce (1 tbsp)
- Vegetable oil (1 tbsp)

Instructions:
1. Trim the ends off the green beans. Mince the garlic cloves.
2. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. Add green beans and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp, stirring occasionally.
4. Drizzle with soy sauce, toss well to coat, and serve immediately.

title: Simple Puri
content:
Ingredients:
- Whole wheat flour
- Water
- Cooking oil

Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix flour with enough water to form a firm, smooth dough.
2. Divide the dough into small balls and roll each into a thin, round disc.
3. Heat cooking oil in a deep pan and fry each puri until it puffs up and turns golden on both sides.

title: Feta Psiti me Domates
content:
Ingredients:
- 2 large eggs
- 1 slice American cheese
- 1/2 tablespoon butter
- 1 pinch salt and pepper

Instructions:
1. Whisk eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper in a small bowl.
2. Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. Pour eggs into the hot skillet and cook, stirring gently, until mostly set.
4. Fold in the American cheese slice until just melted, then serve immediately.

title: Quesadillas Sencillas
content:
Ingredients:
  • - 500g raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
  • - 6 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
  • - 1/2 cup olive oil
  • - 1 small dried red chili, crumbled (optional)
  • - Salt to taste
  • - Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

Instructions:
1. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet or cazuela over medium-high heat.
2. Add the sliced garlic and the crumbled red chili (if using) to the hot oil. Sauté for about 1-2 minutes until the garlic is fragrant and lightly golden, being careful not to burn it.
3. Add the shrimp to the skillet and season with salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp turn pink and opaque.
4. Remove from heat, sprinkle with fresh parsley, and serve immediately.

title: Spicy Plantain & Bean Skillet
content:
Ingredients:
- 2 slices bread
- 2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter
- 1/2 banana, sliced

Instructions:
1. Toast the bread to your desired crispness.
2. Spread peanut butter evenly over each slice of warm toast.
3. Arrange banana slices on top of the peanut butter toast.

title: Garlic Green Bean Stir-fry
content:
Ingredients:
- 2 patatas medianas
- 3 huevos grandes
- Aceite de oliva

Instructions:
1. Pela y corta las patatas en rodajas finas o dados pequeños. Fríelas en abundante aceite de oliva a fuego medio hasta que estén blandas y ligeramente doradas.
2. En un bol, bate los huevos y sazona con sal. Escurre bien las patatas del aceite y añádelas al huevo batido, mezclando suavemente.
3. Calienta una sartén antiadherente con un chorrito de aceite. Vierte la mezcla y cocina a fuego medio-bajo, volteando la tortilla hasta que esté dorada por ambos lados y cuajada a tu gusto.

title: Simple Yellow Dal Tadka
content:
Ingredients:
- 200g sliced chicken breast
- 1 cup fresh green beans, trimmed and halved
- 2 tablespoons Prik King curry paste

Instructions:
1. Heat a little oil in a wok over medium-high heat, add chicken and stir-fry until almost cooked.
2. Add Prik King curry paste and stir continuously for 1-2 minutes until fragrant and coating the chicken.
3. Add green beans and a splash of water, stir-fry until beans are tender-crisp and chicken is fully cooked.

title: Pad Pak Ruam Gai (Chicken and Mixed Vegetable Stir-fry)
content:
Ingredients:
- 200g chicken breast, sliced
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g., broccoli florets, sliced carrots)
- 1 tbsp soy sauce
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
2. Add sliced chicken to the pan and stir-fry until cooked through and no longer pink.
3. Add mixed vegetables and soy sauce, then continue to stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp. Serve hot.

title: Feta Sto Fourno
content:
Ingredients:
- Feta cheese (200g)
- Greek yogurt (2 tbsp)
- Red chili flakes (1/2 tsp)

Instructions:
1. Crumble feta cheese into a bowl.
2. Add Greek yogurt and red chili flakes.
3. Mash with a fork until mostly smooth.

title: Patta Gobhi Sabzi
content:
Ingredients:
- 1 small head cabbage, finely chopped
- 1 medium onion, thinly sliced
- 1-2 green chilies, slit (adjust to taste)
- 2 tbsp cooking oil
- 1/2 tsp mustard seeds
- 1/4 tsp turmeric powder
- Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter, then add sliced onion and green chilies. Sauté until the onion turns translucent.
2. Add the chopped cabbage, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix everything well to combine.
3. Cover the pan and cook on low-medium heat for 10-15 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender, stirring occasionally. Serve hot.
